page.title: 09INDUSTRY, KIRKBY UNDERWOOD
page.content: The only large industrial concern in the area is that of Nelson Green & Son agricultural and heavy plant machine engineers based in Kirkby Underwood. Mr.Green came to the village in 1936 to start his agricultural parts and repair business. At one time the local council tried to close the concern but three members of the Parish Council made a personal visit to the Minister of Transport and the business was allowed to continue. Now only seven full-time workers are employed but other firms rely on the business - tyre, blacksmith, sales, etc. The firm is very much an international concern. One byproduct is the aquisition of vintage vehicles, including military. Many are kept at the old aerodrome a little to the north. 56 vintage agric- ultural vehicles are kept in the village and may be seen by the public.
